TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1133
TEI.2.document_title: Jared E Groce to Stephen F Austin, 06-11-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Jared E. Groce to Austin, June 11, 1825. Indorsing action in the Buckner case.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1133

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Jared E. Groce to Austin, June 11, 1825. Indorsing action in the Buckner case.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Groces retreate*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="06-11-1825"> June 11,1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I received yours of *date_mentioned n="06-07-1825">7th*/date_mentioned* and immediate attended to it and sent to *person_mentioned*Colo Coles*/person_mentioned* and he has wrote to you I think you are takeing a stand now that will releave you of Much difficulty as to your success it is with you for you have the power to do as you please, for every man is bound to Obey; you will excuse me for not coming down as I intended to do so but*date_mentioned n="06-10-1825"> last night*/date_mentioned* there were *person_mentioned*gentlemen from the *location_mentioned*united States*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* come on here and as I think and know every man is bound to obay you I omit coming.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jared E Groce*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
